title: Calories in a Vodka Shot
meta_description: Discover calories in an vodka (standard 1.5 oz shot), plus zero carbs, protein details, and nutrition tweaks for mixers or proof variations.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) distilled vodka, plain, no mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any added ingredients; alcohol content affects calorie density. Consult labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One standard shot of 80-proof vodka contains about 96 calories, all from alcohol.

basis.label: per 1 shot (1.5 fl oz or 44 ml)

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison; vodka has no macros beyond calories.

faqs.q: How many calories in an vodka shot?
faqs.a: About 96 calories for a standard 1.5 oz 80-proof shot.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No, plain distilled vodka has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars.
Proof (alcohol percentage) and serving size; higher proof means more calories per ml.

faqs.q: Calories in vodka vs. other spirits?
faqs.a: Similar for gin or rum at same proof and sizeâ€”around 96 kcal per 1.5 oz shot.
Yes for plain shots, but mixers like juice or soda can add 50+ calories easily.
